page.title: 03Locals & Newcomers, Bridgham
page.content:
Of the many changes that have taken place in village life over the last 20 years, perhaps the most significant has been the arrival of the newcomer.
From returns made to a survey, we discovered that 22.5% of the population now living in the village were actually born in Bridgham, whilst a further 38% were born elsewhere in East Anglia. The remaining 39.5% of the returns showed birth places in other parts of the country and indeed, from other countries. Whilst it may be argued that, in many places, locals and newcomers do not always mix well together, this cannot be said of Bridgham: for such a small village, there is a great deal of community atmosphere and spirit _ best illustrated by the response to the proposed gravel works.
